title: From Walmart to Gap, Which Retailers Have the Most Excess Inventory? Goods are piling up as major retail chains struggle to match supply with demand. Here is how their problems compare.
text:
Beyond the big-box stores, clothing retailers are also stuck with items they don't want.

Shoppers have shifted their spending from the casual wear that had been in demand during the height of the pandemic, catching some apparel retailers off guard and leaving them with excess goods that need to be marked down.

Inventory at some retailers such as Macy's Inc. are still below prepandemic levels due to supply-chain shortages that allowed them to clear out excess goods and have kept certain items in short supply.

Home-improvement retailers Home Depot Inc. and Lowe's Cos. also have reported inventory growth that outpaced sales. Executives at those companies said the late start to springlike weather in many parts of the country was a factor, because it delayed home-improvement projects.

"As spring kicks in, we'll see that inventory begin to reflect the seasonality," Home Depot Finance Chief Richard McPhail told analysts.

While the excess goods are a problem for retailers, consumers could benefit this summer, as stores offer discounts in hopes of clearing out unwanted merchandise.
